com.sun.darkstar.example.snowman.game.input.util
Class InputManager

java.lang.Object
  com.sun.darkstar.example.snowman.unit.Manager
      com.sun.darkstar.example.snowman.game.input.util.InputManager

public final class InputManager
extends Manager

InputManager is a Manager that is responsible for managing all IInputConverter and IController instances. It is responsible for the creation, retrieval and destruction of all the input handling instances.

InputManager is invoked by Game every frame to update all the maintained IController instances.

InputManager maintains all IInputConverter as singleton instances. There can only exist a single instance of one type of IInputConverter at any given time. These converters are maintained by their EInputHandler enumerations.

InputManager allows multiple instances of the same type of IController. These controllers are maintained by their corresponding IEntity.

InputManager provides convenient method for activating or deactivating all input handlers via a single invocation.

Version:
Creation date: 07-15-2008 23:18 EST, Modified date: 07-30-2008 11:23 EST
Author:
Yi Wang (Neakor), Tim Poliquin (Weenahmen)
